p: Hence, it is clear that menthol is the principal major component of the studied EO, which is in agreement with several other works.[ 9 10] Regarding other components, our results diverge from those published by other authors; in fact, the team research of Laghouiter et al.[ 11] has found that M. piperita from South Algeria is composed by trans-carveol (58.98%), D-limonene (19.94%), carvone (2.07%), and 4-terpineol (3.01%); hence, Yadegarinia et al.[ 12] showed that EO of M. piperita from Iran presented a significantly different chemical composition, consisting of a-terpinene (19.7%), isomenthone (10.3%), trans-carveol (14.5%), piperitenone oxide (19.3%) and Î²-caryophyllene (7.6%).
